summary: This is a sworn statement transcript from a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Captain, conducted on October 27, 2021. The interview focuses on allegations that Correctional Officer Tova Noel was instructed to falsify training documents (specifically SHU quarterly training and suicide prevention training) without actually receiving the training. The Captain denies instructing Noel to sign the documents and explains the standard training procedures and record-keeping at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The interview is part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: The Captain was the administrative lieutenant handling schedules and leave for officers, including Noel while she was on injury leave. Noel considered him her supervisor during that period.
The Captain coordinated with the SHU Lieutenant to schedule training and ensure returning officers completed mandatory SHU quarterly training.
According to standard procedure and the Captain's account, the SHU Lieutenant was responsible for providing Noel with the required training upon her return to work.
Tartaglione was Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York prior to Epstein's death.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducts a sworn, recorded interview with a BOP Captain as part of its investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on training falsification allegations.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, New York (OIG New York Field Office)
keyFacts: The OIG is investigating allegations that BOP Captain instructed CO Tova Noel to falsify training records by signing sign-in sheets for SHU quarterly training and suicide prevention training in June 2019 without actually receiving the training.

Captain vehemently denies the allegations, stating he only told Noel she needed to complete the training and coordinated with the SHU Lieutenant to provide it. He claims he never handed her the sign-in sheets or told her to sign them.

Noel, under oath in a prior interview, stated with clarity that Captain specifically instructed her to sign the documents for a 'program review,' told her not to date them, and did not provide any training.

The Captain explains that as the administrative lieutenant, he scheduled training and maintained the sign-in sheets in a binder in his office, but the SHU Lieutenant was responsible for conducting the training and having employees sign.

The interview reveals a direct contradiction under oath between the accounts of Captain and CO Tova Noel regarding who instructed her to sign the training documents, a key element of the OIG's investigation into potential misconduct at MCC.
